ray.audio

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.audio.Resource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AudioResource

    public abstract class Resource
extends java.lang.Object
    Modified from SAGE. This class encapsulates the notion of a "game resource" within SAGE. A Resource can be one of several types: Graphic (e.g. JPG, PNG, etc.), Audio (e.g. .wav, .mp3, etc.), or other resource type; see ResourceType for a list of all supported Resources). Each resource type is typically implemented via a subclass of this class (for example, class AudioResource extends Resource).
    Author:
    John Clevenger Modified from the SAGE Audio package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz.

      Returns the relative path to the file defining this resource
      int getScope()
      Returns the game scope within which this resource applies; a '1' in a bit position indicates the resource is required by the corresponding game scene/level, with the rightmost bit indicating "level 1".
      ResourceType getType()
      Returns the type of this resource as defined by ResourceType
      abstract void load()
      Implemented by subclasses to load the content of this resource
      abstract void unload()
      Implemented by subclasses to unload (release) this resource

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        public java.util.UUID getID()
        Returns the UUID (Universally Unique ID) associated with this resource
        Returns:
        this resource's id

      • getScope

        public int getScope()
        Returns the game scope within which this resource applies; a '1' in a bit position indicates the resource is required by the corresponding game scene/level, with the rightmost bit indicating "level 1". For example, a scope value of 0x0006 indicates the resource is required in game levels 2 and 3. A value of zero indicates the resource is global and must remain loaded for the entire game

      • getRelativePath

        public java.lang.String getRelativePath()
        Returns the relative path to the file defining this resource

      • getType

        public ResourceType getType()
        Returns the type of this resource as defined by ResourceType

      • load

        public abstract void load()
        Implemented by subclasses to load the content of this resource

      • unload

        public abstract void unload()
        Implemented by subclasses to unload (release) this resource
